editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

editorialNotes.standard: Tear apart the world to rebuild it in this creative post-apocalyptic survival game with an upgrade system that compels us to explore and experiment.
This acclaimed platformer motivates you to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

editorialNotes.standard: Battle demigods with flying swords to lift a fantastical Chinese kingdom’s curse in this action-packed roguelike game.

For builders and tinkerers, the planet Woanope couldn’t be a better place to be stranded. It’s overflowing with flowers, crystals, animals and a zillion other resources you can quickly craft into everything from comfy furniture to vicious weapons. A never-ending string of new locations and inventions keeps this survival RPG engrossing, and its oddball humour pulls you in even more. We looked forward to every wacky conversation with our robo-companion and random alien creatures—and to the awesome discoveries we’d make when they sent us on quests.
editorialNotes.short: Fight monsters. Chop down trees. Build new things. It's a survivalist's delight.

editorialNotes.standard: The same thought popped into our head again and again while playing Banner Saga 2: We’re gonna remember this game. The gripping story. The thrilling turn-based battles. The heroes we lost in our struggle against the Dredge. Epic in every way, it’s a beautiful and heart-rending adventure.
editorialNotes.short: A stunning story with epic battles.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Plenty of games cast you as an outgoing hero, exploring the wilds with sword in hand - but nobody does it quite like Superbrothers. Stunning art, a haunting soundtrack and poetic storytelling combine to create a magical, mythical mystery that stays with you long after you put it down.
editorialNotes.short: Embark on a journey of music and mysteries in this incredible artistic experience.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: One of the most influential RPGs of all time, Final Fantasy VII takes you on an unforgettable journey through a harsh and unforgiving sci-fi landscape. Packed with tense turn-based combat and an extraordinary story, Square Enix’s masterpiece is as exhilarating now as it was when it was first released in 1997.

name: 新仙劍奇俠傳(正版單機)

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Intuitive deck building, a sinister game show setting, and snarky quips from a malevolent Lady Luck keep us coming back to roll the dice in this fantastic roguelike.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Hold it! Our favourite ace attorney takes the stand for another quirky case.

editorialNotes.standard: Angling for an unconventional RPG? Try casting a line to catch foes in a playful, puzzle-filled realm.

Rarely does a game throw us like Road Not Taken did—but in a good way. Its fairy-tale visuals made us think haunting adventure game, and that’s in there. The gameplay has puzzler-style matching, tough roguelike random levels and a town hub where you sweet-talk someone into marrying you. Unique, right? It takes a little getting used to, but we ended up fascinated by how it all comes together so beautifully.
editorialNotes.short: Find a safe path through this stylish adventure.

Fighting Fantasy: The Forest of Doom

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Originally released in 2000, Final Fantasy IX set a new standard for the series—and it’s still astoundingly impressive. It’s a perfect blend of beloved RPG elements from previous entries and modernised battle encounters. As you make your way through the story’s twists and turns, you’ll encounter unforgettable characters, frighteningly powerful enemies and a wonderful fantasy world to explore.
